column4: ok, well i got ubuntu to boot on my hammerhead tablet.. but now i can't get the stylus to work..
anyone know anything about stylus's and tablet pc's?
does anyone know anything about stylus's?
negative... i have a Hammerhead XRT. im trying to avoid using windows xp tablet edition.
Oh, so you mean a tablet pc, not a "canon stylus" series printer
So, well, I have some experience, though not with model in particular... most of the screens act as a synaptics device
well i got it installed using a dell inspiron 1000 laptop. then popped the installed hdd into the hammerhead
had a bit of trouble getting it to boot at first, but that was operator error
perhaps there is a distro of linux more oriented at tablet computing?
I don't know. You didn't really say what your current problem is in detail, either :)
my problem is, i have no OSK and the stylus doesn't do anything.. the pointer is sitting stationary in the middle of the screen. i have to plug a keyboard in to use the thing

well, I figure you could fix your xorg configuration for your stylus to work, manually (should be like for any synaptics device if your hardware is similar - sorry, can't google you a link, but at least this gives you search terms...)
as far as an osk goes, how would you operate that without stylus?
thats the other problem.. the hardware spec's are very sparse.. (by plugging in a keyboard via the 1 usb port it has)
there's various tools to get very exact hardware specs, such as "lshw", "lspci", "lsusb", "hwinfo", the kde / gnome hardware viewers...
mm i will try that.. maybe i can find something..
dunno what i will do with what i find though >_<
